column5: I Usually post on another board as I am not really a walleye fisherman, but after this trip i think ive been converted and a few people from that other board turned me onto this one so i figured id start out with a trip report, I just returned from my yearly fly-in, we usually target big pike and last years trip to Beteau was just legendary. So when the owner of that lodge, Eddie north suggested that we be the first ones to fly-in to his new camp on Richter lake we jumped at the chance, and man were we glad we did. This Lake has been unfished since 1991, and it showed, the second day after lunch we had a contest to see who could be first to 100 fish, it took me 3 hours and 20 minutes, now that was some fast action! heres a few videos from that dayhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CNhR4jVT86ghttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p7ekT...eature=related Thats pretty much how the fishing was for the entire week. We caught fish on jigs casting into the rocky shores, we caught them on crankbaits casting the flats and we caught them trolling the shorlines as well, heres another video of just how easy it is to troll and catch fish up therehttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h3H7T...eature=relatedhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bpT1s...eature=related The fish up there are simply not wary of people at all, in fact we often looked into the water and found them swimming around our boat, in the 6 days we were up there we caught between 2000 and 2300 walleye and lots of pike up to 40 inches. The fact that the sun comes out around 4am and stays out till midnight doesn't hurt either, and we took full advantage often putting in 12 hours on the water per day. The place is literally a walleye factory and somewhere I will definitely return to in the near future. heres a few pics from up there just to give you guys an idea what its like http://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._3858656_n.jpghttp://a1.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._3407249_n.jpghttp://a2.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._3527206_n.jpghttp://a6.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._3643990_n.jpghttp://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._7761842_n.jpghttp://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._5200155_n.jpghttp://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._5587766_n.jpghttp://a7.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphot..._1074454_n.jpg
Is there a website or something for this outfitter? Looks like you had a great trip.

sorry the outfitter is eddienorth.com i didnt know if we were allowed to post websites, give eddie a call hes a great guy, larger than life, this is my second trip with him, and im eddie north for life now. thanks guys, tight lines fish
thanks for the great post and visuals. glad you had such a great trip.
You had a great week up at the out post.....thanks for sharing the video and photos. Rich B
Great post fish!! Really enjoyed the videos and pics. That looks like walleye heaven!! Thanks for sharing it with us.
I have a trip booked with Eddie to Richter lake in September. Now I'm pumped!!
I really want to go there. Someday.....
Thanks for posting the great trip report. Looks like fun fishing.
